frame.name: Damaging
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> affects a <fen>Patient</fen> in such a way that the <fen>Patient</fen> (or some <fen>Subregion</fen> of the <fen>Patient</fen>) ends up in a non-canonical state. Often this non-canonical state is undesirable, and some lexical units (marked with the Negative semantic type) specifically indicate that the <fen>Patient</fen> is negatively affected. Some lexical units of this frame indicate by what means the <fen>Patient</fen> is altered (e.g., scrape.v) and in some cases give some indication of the detailed effect on the <fen>Patient</fen> (e.g., score.v, chip.v), and in other cases, both are specified (tear.v). For another set of lexical units, the action and its result are much less specified (e.g., damage.v).
Compare this frame with Destroying, Cause_to_fragment, and Render_nonfunctional.
<ex><fex name="Agent">That idiot</fex> just <t>dented</t> <fex name="Patient">my car</fex>!</ex> <ex><fex name="Agent">Some ne'er-do-wells</fex> <t>defaced</t> <fex name="Patient">the Park's wall</fex> <fex name="Instrument">with spray paint</fex> <fex name="Purpose">to show their anger at local natural resources allocation policy</fex>.</ex> <ex>Please don't <t>damage</t> <fex name="Patient">the goods</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition: <def-root>The conscious entity, generally a person, that performs the intentional action that results in the damage to the <fen>Patient</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>The degree to which the <fen>Patient</fen> is damaged. <ex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Instrument
FE.definition: <def-root>An entity directed by the <fen>Agent</fen> that interacts with a <fen>Patient</fen> to accomplish the damage. </def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the action of damaging which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (<ment>probably, presumably, mysteriously</ment>), force (<ment>hard, softly</ment>), secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Agent</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>). </def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>An intentional action performed by the <fen>Agent</fen> that accomplishes the damage. </def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the location of the scene where a <fen>Agent</fen> damages a <fen>Patient</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the purpose for which an <fen>Agent</fen> causes the damage to the <fen>Patient</fen>. <ex>The dock workers <t>keyed</t> their manager's car <fex name="Purp">to protest their working conditions</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>A state of affairs that the <fen>Agent</fen> is responding to in performing the action. <ex>He <t>rent</t> his garment <fex name="Explanation">out of the despair that only biblical character can feel</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Subregion
FE.definition: <def-root>The part of the <fen>Patient</fen> which is directly affected by the damaging. <ex>The dog <t>tore</t> his pants <fex name="Subr">just below the seat</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> damages the <fen>Patient</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Patient
FE.definition: <def-root>The entity which is affected by the <fen>Agent</fen> so that it is damaged. <ex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Character_of_end_state
FE.definition:
<def-root>A description of the state of the <fen>Patient</fen> after the damaging has taken place, including descriptions of the severity and the permanence of the damaged condition.
<ex>To a all appearances, she had <fex name="cha">permanently</fex> <t>damaged</t> her right clavicle.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Result
FE.definition:
<def-root>Result of the <fen>Agent</fen>'s action.
<ex>She <t>tore</t> the sugar packet <fex name="Result">open</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Cause
FE.definition:
<def-root>An event which leads to the damage of the <fen>Patient</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Cause">The crash</fex> <t>dented</t> my car pretty bad.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: vandalisme.n
lexUnit.definition: van dingen op straat en in openbare gebouwen, uit verveling en baldadigheid
